application_type_full: Full planning & demolition in a conservation area

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: CONARA Name: Kingston Hill Conservation Area
NEIPOL Name: MC1  Maldens and Coombe
TPAREA Ref: MAC.05.52Tree ref: A128Tree category: ADetails: M&C Order no: 05 Year: 1952

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT
LBCASE LB Address: KINGSTON UNIVERSITYKINGSTON HILL (southeast side)KINGSTONLB Grade: GD2LB Ref: 2/2

decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development shall be implemented in accordance with the detailed recommendations and mitigation measures  set out in the submitted Winter Bat Habitat Assessment with Spring & Summer Addendums rev 3 dated 3 July 2021, to  include bat emergence survey within 10 days of the demolition of Prayer Hut 1.Reason: To safeguard the biodiversity and nature conservation value of the site, in accordance with policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS3 and DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development shall be implemented in accordance with the detailed recommendations and mitigation measures  set out in the submitted document prepared by Warwick Reynolds Associates dated 10 May 2021, to  include a visual inspection by an experienced ecologist the day before demolition takes place and if deemed necessary,carry out a watching brief during demolition.Reason: To safeguard the biodiversity and nature conservation value of the site, in accordance with policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS3 and DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Within 6 months from the date of this permission, a scheme to enhance the nature conservation interest of the site, and/or a location within 50m of the development site, shall have been submitted to and agreed in writing by the local planning authority. The approved scheme shall be implemented in full in accordance with timescales to be set out within the nature enhancement strategy.Reason: To safeguard the biodiversity and nature conservation value of the site, in accordance with policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS3 and DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the submitted Arboricultural Method Statement V1 July 2021. The approved measures shall be implemented prior to commencement of any work on site and maintained to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority until the completion of the development.Reason: To safeguard trees worthy of retention and in the interests of the character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policy G7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the Interim Landscape details shown on drawing  RBA-KHC-024 B Proposed Site Layout Plan, which shall be implemented within the first planting season following substantial completion of the development. Within a period of 18 months following the grant of this permission, a finalised Landscape scheme shall be submitted to and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The finalised landscape scheme to be implemented within the next planting season. The tree planting and landscaping shall thereafter be maintained for a period of five years to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or shrubs which die, are removed or become diseased during this period shall be replaced during the following planting season, and the areas shown to be landscaped shall be permanently retained for that purpose. Alterations to the landscaping scheme must be agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the Proposed Demolition Methodology Statement KPH Deconstruction.Reason : In the interests of the amenities of residents and highway safety.
description: Proposed demolition of Huts 1 & 2; Computer Centre; and Drama Hall and associated development.
